bio.summary: There are at least 18 bands with the names The Angels or Angels 1. The Angels The Angels, a American all male R&B group, were formed in Philadelphia 1950. Were signed with Grand records in 1954 and released they first single “Wedding Bells Are Ringing In My Ears” Entered Billboard's R&B Territorial Best Seller charts as “Wedding Bells” by The Angels in October 1954. The Angels re-formed with two new members in 1956. 2. The Angels, a American all male R&B group, were formed in New Jersey 1954. Read more on Last.fm
bio.content: There are at least 18 bands with the names The Angels or Angels 1. The Angels The Angels, a American all male R&B group, were formed in Philadelphia 1950. Were signed with Grand records in 1954 and released they first single “Wedding Bells Are Ringing In My Ears” Entered Billboard's R&B Territorial Best Seller charts as “Wedding Bells” by The Angels in October 1954. The Angels re-formed with two new members in 1956. 2. The Angels, a American all male R&B group, were formed in New Jersey 1954. In October 1956, first single was ”Glory of Love”, an old standard which had been written by Billy Hill back in 1936, when it had become a #1 hit for the Benny Goodman Orchestra. Nelson Martin couldn’t devote as much time with the group and The Angels disband 1958. 3. The Angels, UK Reggae group release single “I Got You Babe” appears on album The Rhythm Of Reggae - Various Artists in 2000. Angels, UK Reggae group release single Kiss For My Love and appears on album Original Ska Explosion Vol 1 (1961-1964) 4. The Angels, a American girl Pop group, were originally known as The Starlets and released two singles “P.S. I Love You” and “Romeo and Juliet” with Astro Records in 1960. All girl group best known hit single "My Boyfriend's Back" in 1963. Renamed themselves as The Powder Puffs, The Beach Nuts in 1964, The Halos from 1964-1967, The Baby Dolls in 1968. 5. The Angels, a Brazilian released an album Happy Weekend With the Angels in 1964. 6. The Angels, a Australian Hard Rock were active from the 70's through 00's. The band renamed themselves as Angel City to avoid confusion with “Angel” in the USA . International names were Angel City (1980-1985) (although that name is also used by another Angel City), The Angels From Angel City (1988-1989) and The Angels (1992). 7. The Angels, a Belgium Pop group, single was "Dance With Us" in 1983. 8. The Angels, a Italian group, only released one single "Seventh Heaven" in 1984. 9. Angels, a Italian group, released 12 inch single "Star Of The Streets" in 1985. 10. Angels, a Italian group, released 12 inch single "Love Is Free" in 1996. 11. Angels, a Spanish group, released single "Ave Virgo", which appears on Puzzletron 5 in 1997. 12. Angels, a Italian singer, released 12 inch single "Deep Inside" in 1997 follow by 12 inch single "I Will Never Love You Again" in 1998. 13. The Angels, a France Electronic, released 12 inch single was "Angel" in July 1999. 14. Angels, a Japanese female violin duo by the names of DJ Yumi and Naoko, known for playing violin along to electronic music (namely trance). Best known for their songs Mission (FUGA) and Angels theme (G-Aria) for the Area 88 anime TV series in 2004. 15. Angels, Mexican duo released album Siguiendo el Camino by Angels in 2005 16. Angels, a Swedish band playing Adult Alternative Pop/Rock and with a 2005 release, Time Is Ripe. Offering the entire album for free download at Time Is Ripe. 17. Angels, a Norwegian Pop Children duo and released a album Livet Er Topp on 1 January 2008. 18. Angels, an all-female rock band from Croatia. Martina (Mimi) Begčević and Matilda Oroši wanted to form an all female hard rock group. Tea Misković and Irena Rogović had the same taste in hard rock music and Angels were formed in Croatian town of Crikvenica. 19. Angels was a pop music band from Romania formed by Raluca Ciocârlan and Monica Ene . They have formed a group with Costi Ionita. He listened to Raluca singing a song from the repertoire of Celine Dion and was impressed by her vocal skills. Judging by the tracks in the charts, there are possibly other artists using this name. Please add some information if you know anything about them. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
